alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 08 at 1:53AM PST until March 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 45 to 60 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. Winds could gust as high as 90 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...In California, Modoc County. In Oregon, Eastern Klamath County and much of Lake County. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Loose objects could be blown around and become dangerous projectiles. Tree damage and power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Confidence in the occurrence of strong winds is high. However, timing of the strongest winds remains uncertain. Along the higher terrain at least, these winds will also be occuring with impactful snowfall amounts. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Dangerous driving conditions are possible, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Downed trees and power lines are possible. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Lake County; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
